definitions.definition: a change or set of changes to something

examples.text: He made some minor revisions to the report before printing it out.
They called for revisions to the treaty.
an upward revision of government expenditure plans
A revision of the budget was approved in October.

definitions.definition: the act of changing something, or of examining something with the intention of changing it

examples.text: The system is in need of revision.
Their educational policies are due for revision.
Our conclusions are always open to revision in the light of fresh evidence.
The process of revision continued at rehearsals.
The plan has recently undergone drastic revision.
This has brought about a radical revision in the style of school management.

definitions.definition: the process of learning work for an exam

examples.text: Have you started your revision yet?

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French révision or late Latin revisio(n-), from the verb revisere ‘look at again’, from re- ‘again’ + visere (intensive form of videre ‘to see’).
